q: Mike Pence said he made the final decision not to run for president Wednesday night. He and his wife told their two daughters and then called their son, who is in college, early Thursday. We just concluded that while we could seek the presidency, we concluded that our best opportunity to continue to serve the people of Indiana was either in Washington, D.C., or here at home, Mike Pence said. 01/27/11 05:03 PM ET Rep. Mike Pence ( R-Ind.) will not make a bid for the GOP presidential nomination in 2012, telling supporters in a letter that he would rather serve the state of Indiana. In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana, Mike Pence wrote, Still, Mike Pence is not officially jumping into the race for Indiana governor just yet. The congressman said he expects to make a decision "later this year" about his next step

last lines of his State of the Union address. Barack Obama Chuck Schumer praised the president's commonsense call for trimming the federal budget and creating jobs, without cutting programs that could hurt the American Dream. "The Barack Obama has offered a balanced approach that hopefully can garner bipartisan support. He is aware of the need to rein in spending but also the need to grow jobs, the economy and middle class paychecks. It makes sense to cut programs that are wasteful and unnecessary, but grow the programs that are needed to preserve the American dream. The Barack Obama showed the kind of optimism that America relishes, thrives on and believes in."
